DOCNAME: KRSTEV v. "THE FORMER YUGOSLAV REPUBLIC OF MACEDONIA"
JUDGES: Ganna Yudkivska;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste
TEXT: The applicants , Mr PERSON ( “ the first applicant ” ) , Mr PERSON ( “ the second applicant ” ) , PERSON Ivanovska ( “ the third applicant ” ) , PERSON ( “ the fourth applicant ” ) , PERSON ( “ the fifth applicant ” ) , Mr PERSON ( “ the sixth applicant ” ) , Mr PERSON ( “ the seventh applicant ” ) , Mr Dimče Pop GPE ( “ the eighth applicant ” ) , Mr PERSON ( “ the ninth applicant ” ) , PERSON GPE ( “ the tenth applicant ” ) and Mr PERSON ( “ the eleventh applicant ” ) are all NORP nationals ( for personal details see the Annex ) . The first and ninth applicants are represented before the ORG by PERSON ; the second , third and fourth applicants by PERSON NORP GPE ; DATE applicants by Mr PERSON and the sixth , seventh and eighth applicants by PERSON V. PERSON , lawyers practising in GPE , PERSON and PERSON respectively . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicants were all members of the Government security forces either as police officers or reservists , with the exception of the second , third and fourth applicants , who are the next of kin of a deceased police officer .

Following the armed conflict that took place in the former GPE in DATE , the applicants brought civil proceedings against the ORG seeking compensation for injuries ( or death , in case of the second , third and fourth applicants ) sustained in the conflict . All the applicants were successful at first and second instance , receiving final decisions in which the courts ordered the ORG to pay damages under sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW ( see “ Relevant domestic law ” below ) . Only the eleventh applicant had his claim dismissed at both levels .

These decisions were reviewed by ORG by way of an appeal on points of law ( ревизија ) in respect of DATE applicants or by way of a request by the public prosecutor for the protection of legality ( барање за заштита на законитоста ) , in respect of the remaining applicants .
As to the outcome of the proceedings before ORG :
a ) ORG accepted the public prosecutor ’s request for the protection of legality , overturned the lower courts’ decisions and dismissed the compensation claims submitted by the following applicants :
i ) the first applicant ( Гзз.бр.CARDINAL/CARDINAL of DATE ) . The introductory part of this decision stated that it was taken after the court had heard oral evidence from the public prosecutor ;

ii ) the second , third and fourth applicants ( Гзз.бр. CARDINAL/CARDINAL and PERSON of DATE ) . According to the introductory part of this decision , it was taken in the absence of the public prosecutor ;
iii ) the fifth applicant ( Гзз.бр. CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE CARDINAL).The decision was taken in the presence of the public prosecutor ; and
iv ) the ninth applicant ( Гзз.бр.CARDINAL/CARDINAL of DATE ) .

b ) In respect of the sixth , seventh and eighth applicants , ORG partly upheld the public prosecutor ’s request for the protection of legality and significantly reduced the award ( Гзз.бр. CARDINAL/CARDINAL of DATE ) . The introductory part of this decision stated that it was taken after the public prosecutor had presented his arguments .

c ) In respect of the tenth applicant , the court allowed the appeal on points of law by the ORG , overturned the lower courts’ decisions and dismissed his claim ( PERSON CARDINAL/CARDINAL of DATE ) and

d ) dismissed the eleventh applicant ’s appeal on points of law submitted against the first- and second - instance courts’ decisions of DATE and DATE , respectively ( Рев.бр. CARDINAL/CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE ) . In these latter decisions , the lower courts had ruled that no responsibility could be attributed to the ORG for the injuries sustained by the eleventh applicant .

As established by the domestic courts , the first , fifth , ninth , tenth and eleventh applicants were injured , under different circumstances , in a fight while on duty as members of the Government security forces . The second , third and fourth applicants’ next of kin was killed in the fight .

ORG found that under section CARDINAL of LAW ( see “ Relevant domestic law ” below ) the LAW on special rights of the members of security forces and their families ( “ the DATE Act ” , see “ Relevant domestic law ” below ) , as the lex specialis , applied to the relations between the ORG and the applicants . LAW therefore suspended the application of LAW . However , since section DATE CARDINAL Act did not provide for a right to compensation , the general rules of compensation set forth in LAW should have applied to the applicants’ cases . The court ruled that the ORG could not , under those rules , be held responsible for the injuries which the applicants had sustained in a fight , unless it could be proved that this was not the case . Furthermore , no objective responsibility could be attributed to the ORG for the injuries which the applicants had sustained while on duty . Consequently , section CARDINAL of LAW could not apply to the applicants , as members of the security forces .

As regards the sixth , seventh and eighth applicants , the courts established that they had been injured while being transported in a military helicopter that had crashed after it had hit flagpoles while landing . ORG found the ORG responsible , under section CARDINAL of LAW , for the injuries that these applicants sustained in “ the accident ” .
Under LAW , ORG is the highest court that provides for the uniform application of laws by courts .
Section CARDINAL of LAW of DATE states that it applies to relations regulated by other laws in respect of issues not covered by those laws .
Section CARDINAL of LAW defines the different grounds for claiming civil compensation .
Section CARDINAL provides for the ORG ’s responsibility for any damage caused , inter alia , by a bodily injury sustained as a result of acts of violence or terror .
Under section CARDINAL , in the event , inter alia , of physical pain , mental anguish , disability , disfigurement or death of next of kin or fear , the court may award monetary compensation .

LAW defines the persons concerned , the special rights they are entitled to and procedures under which those rights may be attained . LAW provides the following special rights : the right to be employed ; the right to rent an apartment ; special rights regarding education ; the right to be exempted from paying medical services ; the right to a CARDINAL - off pecuniary allowance ; and the right to obtain a family pension .

The applicants submitted copies of final decisions in which the domestic courts , at CARDINAL levels of jurisdiction , had granted identical claims brought by colleagues of the applicants for injuries ( or death ) sustained in the armed conflict in DATE . According to the applicants , these decisions were not challenged by the public prosecutor and accordingly were not reviewed by ORG . They pre - dated the ORG cases ( Гж.бр.CARDINAL/CARDINAL ; GPE ; PERSON ; PERSON ; PERSON ; Гж.бр.CARDINAL/CARDINAL ; Гж.бр.CARDINAL/CARDINAL and Гж.бр.CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .

They further submitted CARDINAL separate decisions by which ORG had dismissed the request of the public prosecutor for the protection of legality and ruled in favour of the applicants’ colleagues . In these cases , ORG held that an award should be made under LAW and not under LAW , given that the latter did not provide for a right to compensation . The first decision concerned colleagues of DATE applicants who had been injured in the same helicopter accident ( Гзз.бр.CARDINAL/CARDINAL of DATE ) . The second decision concerned a compensation claim by ORG reservists who , while being transported in civilian vehicles , had been attacked in DATE . Relying on the facts established by the lower courts , namely , that the convoy had not been properly guarded , ORG upheld the lower courts’ decisions awarding them compensation ( Гзз.бр.CARDINAL/CARDINAL and Рев.бр.CARDINAL/CARDINAL of DATE ) . In this latter decision , ORG excluded section CARDINAL of LAW from the list of provisions under which it established the ORG ’s responsibility .
